Material used.Description: M17 cells were transiently transfected. PC12 cells were grown and transfected.

Readout description.Conclusion: L166P was barely detectable, M26I had low steady - state levels, R98Q, A104T, D149A were expressed at similar levels to wild - type
Readout description.Molecular Effect: L166P and M26I showed reduced protein stability, R98Q, A104T, D149A were stable
Readout description.Result Description: L166P DJ - 1 was barely detectable under similar conditions. M26I was present at between 30% and 40% of the wild - type levels in M17 cells with tagged constructs. In PC12 cells with untagged constructs, L166P was present at approximately 10% of wild - type levels, whereas M26I was present at approximately 50% of wild type. R98Q, A104T, D149A variants were each expressed at similar levels to wild - type protein.

Biological replicates.Description: Results are representative of at least triplicate transfections for each construct.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way ANOVA with Student - Newman - Kuells post hoc tests were used to evaluate statistical significance.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression level similar to wild - type protein

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Expression level significantly lower than wild - type protein

Material used.Description: Total RNA was extracted from M17 cells.

Readout description.Conclusion: mRNA levels of DJ - 1 in transfected cells were significantly higher than untransfected or GFP transfected cell lines
Readout description.Result Description: Real - time quantitative PCR demonstrated that the mRNA levels of DJ - 1 in the transfected M17 cells were significantly higher than untransfected or GFP transfected cell lines.

Biological replicates.Description: All reactions were performed in quadruplicate and replicated on at least three separate plates.

Technical replicates.Description: All reactions were performed in quadruplicate.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One - way ANOVA with Student - Newman - Kuells post hoc tests; *P < 0.05, comparing control to both WT and M26I.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: mRNA level similar to non - transfected or GFP - transfected cells

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: mRNA level significantly higher than non - transfected or GFP - transfected cells

Material used.Description: M17 cells were transfected with V5 - tagged DJ - 1 for confocal microscopy and mitochondria were isolated from M17 cells for subcellular fractionation.

Readout description.Conclusion: All variants showed similar localization to wild - type protein, and oxidative stress increased mitochondrial localization
Readout description.Result Description: In the majority of cells, wild - type and mutant DJ - 1 were diffusely distributed throughout the cytoplasm with some nuclear staining. A small number of cells showed overlap between DJ - 1 signal and mitotracker. Treatment with paraquat increased the number of cells with strong overlap between mitochondrial staining and DJ - 1. The proportion of cells with mitochondrial DJ - 1 was similar basally between wild - type and mutant proteins but was increased by three - to four - fold in the presence of paraquat. Subcellular fractionation showed a two - fold increase in the amount of M26I DJ - 1 localized to the mitochondria in response to paraquat treatment.

Biological replicates.Description: Each experiment is representative of duplicate transfections performed at least twice for each construct.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Similar proportion of cells with mitochondrial DJ - 1 staining as in non - oxidative conditions

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significantly increased proportion of cells with mitochondrial DJ - 1 staining compared to non - oxidative conditions
